abstract: The Swiss bank plans to eliminate up to 18 percent of its work force to cut costs after it struck a deal in August with Bank of America to buy the American bank’s private banking operations outside the United States and Japan.
snippet: The Swiss bank plans to eliminate up to 18 percent of its work force to cut costs after it struck a deal in August with Bank of America to buy the American bank’s private banking operations outside the United States and Japan.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — The Swiss bank Julius Baer announced on Tuesday that it would eliminate about 1,000 jobs to reduce costs.

headline.main: Julius Baer to Cut 1,000 Jobs After Deal for Bank of America Unit
